Name: Intercept 3
Description:
From the designer:
My take on space combat is that it should resemble submarine warfare more than dogfights or naval action and this require that sensors and weapons to have more or less the same ranges. The system is tailored towards small encounters between small ships, a fight should be fun even if there are only two ships involved.

Play proceeds on printed out maps, one for each player and one common for Spotted ships. Ships use vector movement for movement and are affected by gravity. Planetary Line-Of-Sight, sun direction, ship signatures etc all affect detection and combat. Players may design their own ships to test out ideas on how space battles should be fought.


    Vector movement
    Realistic gravity with stable orbits
    Realistic sensor rules
    Ship design system
    Double-blind system without a referee
    Optional deterministic system with no chance elements

Name: Wer ist's? V.I.P.
Description:
220 cards contain the names of 440 celebrities and four hints for each of them. One player reads the hints one by one, the other players can place a chip on fields 1-4, depending on the number of hints they think they need. When the solution is given, the players who guessed correctly advance 1-4 fields (one if they needed four hints, three for two, etc.). The first player to advance 33 fields is the winner.

The game mechanism strongly resembles "Wer war's" which was published by Noris one year earlier. 
(User summary by HilkMAN)

Name: A Box of Matches
Description: A Box of Matches is an abstract tile placement game for 2 to 4 players using 42 square tiles with one of 4 symbols on each side of the tile. Tiles are worth 1 to 3 points as indicated in the center of the tile. The game begins with a square made of 4 randomly drawn tiles and each player drawing a hand of 3 tiles. Players take turns in clock-wise order placing a tile and replenishing their hand. The newly placed tile must be set side-by-side to the previously played tiles such that any adjoining sides have matching symbols. The turn is scored by adding the value of the newly placed tile to each tile that it touches. The winner is the player with the highest score after all tiles are played.

Name: The New Game of Cash
Description:
The game uses a squared board for play, and involves moving a square of card around the board. Holes punched into the square reveal the designs on the squares of the board below. The idea is to use the card square to reveal coins (which are then matched by examples from the pot) with the intention of arriving at pre-determined sums.

The winner is the individual who achieves his or her sum correctly. The values are in pounds, shillings and pence, and the coins are made from card printed in gold and silver to represent the correct look of the original coinage.

Name: Superschaak
Description:
(from the website)

Superschaak (aka Superchess)

creative chess without opening theory

Playing high-level chess is possible only with a thorough knowledge of the opening theory nowadays. Because of the rapid expansion of the modern opening theory its role becomes too large and sometimes even dominating according to more and more chess players and grandmasters, including Garry Kasparov and Bobby Fischer - by many considered to be the best chess players in the world.

This objection is overcome by Superchess: a natural and logical extension of chess in which the players create the starting position together following a simple procedure. Superchess is virtually chess without the opening theory.

Superchess is played on an ordinary 8x8-chessboard with ordinary chess pieces, but with a few additional new pieces. The new pieces move slightly different from conventional pieces. For example, the Amazon moves like a Queen or Knight. Studying the opening theory will not be worthwile in practice because too many different starting positions exist.

Now it comes down to strategical insight and tactical ingenuity only!

Name: Pass & Score
Description:
Skaters maneuver their players and puck on board to an advantageous shooting position, the best being one of the 18 circled spaces in front of the goal.

For a board game involving pawns and a board of circles, Pass and Score is remarkably faithful to good hockey play. Each player gets three moves in sequence, which can be a combination of moving a pawn one space, passing the puck from one pawn to another along any clear line, and of course shooting on goal. Passes must not violate standard offside rules.

Any given pawn can only move two spaces in a turn, but the board includes "slide" lines that allow bursts of speed on offence or defence. One player takes the puck away from the other by moving a pawn onto the same space as the puck carrier (the pawns have a peg to hold them on top of the puck), "checking" his opponent into an adjacent circle.

Most challenging of all for all players: a penalty is called when either team fails to complete its three-element move within 15 seconds! Going over the limit means you lose one of your pawns for the next three turns.

While intended to be played for fun, it includes a significant teaching component, including dotted lines on the board showing the areas of responsibility for different positions, and a set of 18 Hockey Tips listed inside the box.

Name: La Belle Alliance
Description: The battle of Waterloo, as part of the IGS-series from MMP. The game uses a new regimental scale system of medium complexity, inspired by the NBS-system. La Belle Alliance will include all four battles of the Waterloo Campaign as well as the whole campaign as one big game. Ground scale is 250 m per hex.

Name: Ditto!
Description:
This is the desciption from Ditto!'s web site www.dittothegame.com...

It’s simple to learn and fun to play!  The object of the game is to out-last your opponents by being the last player with cards in your hand.  Whenever you win a round, your opponents discard their losing cards.  But be careful, there are a number of “Trick Cards” that turn winning plays into losing ones, or force you to discard your hand. And then there’s the unstoppable “Boom!” card.  The fun is endless - just keep your wits about you and you’ll emerge as the Ditto! champion!

Name: Axis & Allies: War at Sea – Condition Zebra Booster Pack
Description:
From Avalon Hill website:

All hands on deck for the third expansion to the War at Sea naval miniatures game. Condition Zebra will contain 40 authentically detailed miniatures that war gamers, WWII enthusiasts, and collectors can use to assemble fleets with which to do battle on the seas of World War II. Battleships, cruisers, submarines and aircraft will help you bring the battle to your opponent. Condition Zebra will let players add to their existing navies to recreate historical battles that rage across massive 30"x 40" battle maps.

Condition Zebra details:

40 authentically detailed battleships, aircraft, destroyers & other vessels from WWII. 
Unique ships—such as the USS West Vriginia, IJN Suzuya, and the French Aircraft Carrier Bearn—feature their distinctive markings and camouflage. 
Three new patrol bombers including the English Short Sunderland Flying Boat. 
Prepainted, durable plastic—assembled and ready to play, right out of the box. 
Abilities and statistics of units based on historical performance in battle. 
Accuracy and detail of miniatures attracts collectors and WWII enthusiasts.

Release Date: March 16, 2010

Name: Long Knives
Description:
Long Knives was a set of rules published by Greenfield Hobby Distributors and written by Jim Birdseye.

They were a simple but effective set of rules that depicted Indian vs Cavalry actions in the old west.

No counters came with the game as they were primarily printed with the use of miniatures in mind.

Catalogue Description.
Basic rules for skirmish warfare in the Old West, covering the period 1830-1898, with special emphasis on the post-Civil War era. Rules are based on tactical level engagement where miniatures will represent individual combatants, with a scale of 4 yards per inch and 20 seconds per turn. Historical background and designer notes round out this 28-page booklet, complete with charts and optional procedures for play. Requires a standard deck of cards, six-sided and percentile dice for play (not included).

Name: O&O
Description:
In Ontwikkelaars & Ontwerpers (Developers & Designers) you (and the competing players) are developers of computer games. You only have one goal; design the best game ever!
To achieve this you have to acquire different resources, like art designers, game engines etc. Of course you have to stay ahead of the other developers. You have to use your insight, cunning and financial funds to reach the top.

O&O is a fast-paced deck-building game for 2-4 players suitable for ages 12 and up that can be played anywhere (where there is a flat surface).

Name: The Rapture Game
Description:
Players alternate turns by drawing Fellowship Cards. The fellowship Cards contain fill-in-the-blanks questions about passages from the Bible. Players who respond correctly advance on the gameboard. The Holy Bible, King James Version preferably, should be on hand to verify responses.

Upon reaching "Finish" the player must declare, "Hallelujah, Jesus is Lord" or return to "Start." Otherwise, that player is the victor.

Name: Tank Shocker
Description:
A combination of Combat and Sports, players control robot tanks to score goals against their opponent. 
The first player to five goals is the winner.
The game is made up of various decks of cards including Unit, Command and Obstacle decks.
Players can choose their Robot tanks and aim for a fast accurate team to score quickly or a slower tougher team to take out the opposition.
You will need to supply some D6 and a measuring device.

Name: Belgium 1831
Description:
Belgium 1831 is a political and social-economic influence board game set in the troubled Kingdom of Belgium after their Independence Revolution in 1830.

During the game, players will represent the growing Belgian bourgeoisie and they'll industrialize the Belgian provinces, buying materials to build factories to obtain greater economic power, will vote in the National Congress seeking to increase their political influence, will expand its social mass and will send, to the provinces under their dominion, at the highest authority, King Leopold I of Belgium, to revise the provinces in the pursuit of their own interests.

•••

Belgium 1831 es un juego de mesa de influencias políticas y socioeconómicas ambientado en el convulso Reino de Bélgica tras su Revolución de Independencia de 1830.

Durante el juego, los jugadores representarán a la creciente burguesía, industrializando las provincias belgas, comprando materiales para construir fábricas y así obtener el mayor poder económico, votando en el Congreso Nacional buscando incrementar su influencia política, expandiendo su masa social y enviando a la máxima autoridad, el Rey Leopoldo I de Bélgica, a revisar las provincias bajo su dominio en pos de sus propios intereses.

Name: Micro Mutants: Invasion
Description:
From x-bugs.it:

The first expansion for Micro Mutants, the game that brought to the forefront the classic tiddlywinks game in a completely new variant, presenting funny armies of bugs with different peculiarities and special powers, is on the way.

The expansion Micro Mutants: Invasion will feature the Samuracnids, fierce bug warriors from the Rising Sun, and the Xenomantides, charming amazons from the deep space.

Name: Causeway
Description: Board game that pits "armies" of ten pawns against each other on a hex grid. The moves available to the players are in the form of cards with move diagrams. Each player holds a hand of 3 to 5 cards (depending on how challenging you'd like the game to be). Players may play a single color army, multiple colors, or in teams.

Name: Welcome to Mission
Description:
The object of the game is to discover Mission's history, people and heritage by touring through the city's board game and answering trivia questions.

The board shows a map of the City of Mission, British Columbia. The players move their pieces through the city experiencing some of the ups and downs of the route. At the same time, players will have to answer questions about the history of Mission. The aim is to be the first to travel through Mission to the end.

Description taken from the game box and instruction booklet.

Name: First War for Scottish Independence
Description: This is a Warpspawn two-player card game representing English v. Scots circa 1296-1314 (You all saw "Braveheart").  Game lasts exactly 72 turns, every 4th turn a very short one to account for that year's winter season; automatic victory at any time if one side captures all 20 territory tokens.  Each turn each plays leader, nobles, and troops cards; then event cards to affect cards in play; then strategy cards to enhance their side, highest number of different types of cards gets victory that year, takes a token from the other, may get some additional benefit.  I've made a card set (deleting 2 equally-matched cards, 1 for each side, to fit the cards conveniently on 3 sheets.

Name: Three Musketeers Game: Chess Variant
Description: Publisher Blurb:  The Three Musketeers (Chess Variant) is a two-player abstract strategy board game that represents renaissance  warfare on an 8x14 board with alternating light and dark colored squares representing land, river, bridge, castle, and cathedral terrain. Each terrain type provides specific benefits or obstacles to the different game pieces. Opposing pieces, printed as blue and red chess pieces (but which may be substituted by actual chess pieces), are initially placed in specific locations designated on the game board. Each type of piece has a unique type of movement and capturing occurs when a piece, by its movement, occupies the square of an opposing piece, as in chess. Each side takes turns moving a single one of their pieces trying to gain positional advantage, capture opponents, and achieve their objectives. The Cardinal’s pawn type pieces are an important exception to normal movement rules.  If a pawn is selected to be moved, a total of two pawns may move during a single turn.  These are the only pieces that may do so.  The Three Musketeer player’s knight type pieces may not move until the d’Artagnan rook type piece finishes a turn adjacent to each and activates it.  Until they are activated, they face backwards on the game board and may not move.  The game was inspired by Alexandre Dumas story, The Three Musketeers, and by Chess-like games such as Siege.

Name: Do the Blue Recycling Game
Description:
From the game instructions:

"Promote awareness and create enthusiasm for recycling waste products!

This game was developed through a partnership between Muncie Sanitary District; East Central Indiana Solid Waste District; and East Central Recycling.

Each player receives one of 14 cards representing different items to be recycled.  The players then roll a die and move their game piece around the board attempting to collect all of the recycling cards and placing them into their blue recycling bag!

Don't recycle and get penalized.  Get bumped by another player and lose some of your hard earned trash!  Circle the board until someone recycles them all.

REMEMBER, EVERYONE WINS WHEN YOU RECYCLE!"

Game comes with the following components:
Instructions
Do the Blue board
6 player markers
1 6 sided dice
84 recyclables tiles (6 per each)
Collectible recycling can (CUTE!)

Name: The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game: Legions of Middle-Earth
Description:
The Legions of Middle-earth expansion book is the definitive guide to playing head-to-head games of The Lord of The Rings Strategy Battle Game. With over 40 army lists to choose from, each with its own flavour and unique options, you can create a themed and balanced force from your collection. In addition, rules for allies allow you to use much of your collection, while still respecting the books and films, allowing greater tactical flexibility and the chance to add some favoured models to your army.
(Publisher Website)
Families: Series: The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game (Games Workshop)

Name: Birds of Prey: Reinforcement Pack A – Interceptors and Aggressors
Description:
Birds of Prey: Reinforcement Pack A: Interceptors and Aggressors is a set of twelve new box-miniatures and twelve new missile tents, complementing the folio Birds of Prey: Airborne Alert. The box-miniatures are in exciting new markings representing additional air forces using these aircraft.

Birds of Prey: Reinforcement Pack A: Interceptors and Aggressors contains two each of one sheet of die-cut box-miniatures and missile tents. Players wishing to complement Deluxe or Expanded Editions of Birds of Prey should purchase two Reinforcement Packs to provide four of each box-miniature and missile tent.
Families: Game: Birds of Prey (Ad Astra Games)

Name: The Stork Didn't Bring Me
Description:
From the box: A board game that explains what happens during each of the nine months of pregnancy. Players roll a die and move their game pieces from one month to the next.

From the rules: Players landing on a month square roll again, other squares contain instructions about forward or backward movement.  The first player to reach the finish square is the winner.

Name: The 2010 Election
Description:
THE 2010 ELECTION is a two-player light game about a single election campaign in mainland Great Britain. It is based on the principle that parliamentary boundaries and demographics, as well as party policy, determine elections. Policy may influence the floating voters, but all parties depend on their partisans whose loyalty is not a matter of electoral logic but of passion. You take your supporters where you find them, heavily concentrated for Labour and widely spread for the centrist parties. Psephology is as important as media hype.

The game uses tile placement and area control mechanisms, and there is a random tile draw phase at the end to handle floating voters.

The game is a PDF production, and covers the 2010 Election. Expansion sets will cover historical elections. A set of Liberal Party and Social Democratic Party markers is included for that purpose.

Name: Hanabi & Ikebana
Description:
From the author's web site:

Flower arrangements or fireworks? The choice is yours! This box proposes you two colorful games: 

     Hanabi, a cooperative game in which the players realize together colored fireworks. 
     Ikebana, a competitive game in which the players compete to compose blazing bouquets.


The games use the same material, a set of 55 cards and some colored tokens to propose two completely different rules.

The theme arises from two arts of the Japanese culture: fireworks (Hanabi) and flower arrangement (Ikebana).

Microbadge: 


				
				
					HanabiHanabi is a cooperative game in which the players realize together colored fireworks.

They are going to try to recompose suites of colored cards (maps): 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 the problem being that every player holds his hand of cards back to front, that is each player can see the cards of the others but not his...

Mechanisms: Communication, Deduction

Hanabi is the Japanese word for "fireworks". It is a compound word made from the Japanese words for "Flower" and "Fire".


				
				
					IkebanaIkebana is a competitive game in which the players compete to compose blazing bouquets.

Alternately, they are going to be able to dig up cards or buy back those left aside by their opponents to compose a bouquet of 5 cards and mark points according to represented combinations (pair, three of a kind, suite, etc.)

Mechanisms: Combination, Risk-taking

Ikebana is the Japanese word for "flower arrangement". It is a compound word made from the Japanese words for "Life" and "Flower".

Name: Napoleonic Wargaming
Description:
(user summary)
Another book evolved from 'Wargaming : An Introduction'.

consists of three Parts:

Part One Historical Background
Part Two The Art of Napoleonic Warfare
Part Three The Napoleonic Wargame

The ruleset is very similar to the Napoleonic ruleset contained in the 'Introduction' book. But army compositon is now limited to 8 units (10-15 units in the 'Introduction').  Armylist is also expanded to 20 armies (from 9 in the 'Introduction').

Name: Zaczęło się w Polsce
Description: "ZaczÄ™Å‚o siÄ™ w Polsce" - is an adventure game based almost completely on the mechanics Talisman (the only significant difference is the possibility of playing cards on the opponents). Players take roles of the typical polish characters from the years 1939 - 1989 (doctor, journalist, etc.).. The goal of the game is to cross the fields of World War II (first circle), to survive the times of communism (second circle) and take part in the deliberations of the Round Table (third circle). The player who first reaches the goal wins.

Name: Neighbours
Description:
Neighbours is played on a 8x8 square board.Each player starts with 8 stones on each of the back ranks.
At each turn,each player must move one of his own stones.A stone slides(orthogonally or diagonally) as many cells as there are directly adjacent stones(of either color). It may move to an empty cell or capture an enemy stone.
The first player unable to move loses. Threefold repetition of board position or a high enough number of moves without a capture forces a draw.

Name: Renpaarden
Description:
Renpaarden is played on a 9x9 square board.Each player starts with 18 stones 9 on each of the two back ranks.
A player must move one of his stones.Each stone moves like the chess Knight.
Wins the first player that moves all his stones to the opponent´s initial position.

Name: Crusade
Description:
Crusade can be played on a 8x8 square board. In the initial position, all squares are occupied by a stone: white stones on the white squares and black stones on the black squares.

Each stone must move to any adjacent(orthogonal or diagonal) cell, which is occupied by an enemy stone. This stone is captured by replacement. After that, all adjacent enemy stones (orthogonal or diagonal) are converted to friendly ones. There a less and less stones on the board as the game proceeds, which is a major difference to Othello and Ataxx.

The player which has more stones, after there is no valid move left, wins the game.

Name: Along Bible Roads
Description:
Players receive a number of cards with 8 spaces on them, each containing a Biblical name or reference.

The leader takes the smaller cards one at a time, and reads the question on them.  Players shout if they have the right answer on their scoring card, and the right answer is checked.  If they are correct, the question card is placed on their scoring card; if incorrect, then the player with the correct answer may take the card.

Players win when one of their scoring cards is full.

Name: Pit Jr: Shout it Out!
Description:
Players are given the task of collecting a food group to complete a set.  All the cards are dealt out at the start of each round. Shout your deal and swap cards to collect a set. Be the first player to grab all the cards of one fun food (Pizza, Burgers, Veggies, Cookies and more), then HIT THE PIT and win the round! You then score points depending on which set you have.  Two cards (hungry Bear and chef Bull) may be used to add wild/penalty cards to the gameplay.

This game is virtually the same as the classic version of Pit - it has 65 cards, including 7 commodities with 9 in each commodity, as well as the Bull and Bear cards.

The only actual difference - other than the aesthetics - is that the point values for each commodity have been changed in comparison to the classic version - the commodities are now valued are 100, 80, 75, 65, 60, 55, 50 instead of the classic values of 100, 85, 75, 70, 60, 50, 40.

Name: Thunderstone: Doomgate Legion
Description:
Hiding away in secret for centuries, the order of the Doomgate Legion have guarded the Stone of Avarice from friend and foe alike. Their cult-like existence known only to a few, the Legionnaires dedicate themselves to the secrecy, protection, and worship of the stone. They are its champions. Its sentinels. Its vanguards.

It is up to you to defeat them.

The second expansion to Thunderstone adds more to the game of “deck-building with a purpose.” Doomgate Legions introduces the Cult of the Doomgate, who have guarded the Stone of Avarice for centuries. This cult, along with a sect of evil druids and other all-new monsters await your heroes as they race to secure the third Thunderstone!

Doomgate Legions features two all-new card types: Mercenaries and Treasures! Mercenaries are henchmen for hire in the village who bring all new abilities to the dungeon. Treasures are found after defeating monsters, providing powerful new benefits for your party! Mystic amulets and legendary armor will take your deck to new heights. But beware: the cultists have been at work on strange and horrifying new Diseases that will pose major hurdles for your heroes!

[From Publisher Website]

				
				
					Card Types


    
        Heroes

        Village

    
    
        Deep

        Blessed Hammer

    
    
        Drunari

        Border Guard

    
    
        Sidhe

        Cyclone

    
    
        Slynn

        Divine Staff

    
    
        Tempest

        Doomgate Squire

    
    
        Tholis

        Flask of Oil

    
    
        Verdan

        Fortune Teller

    
    
        

        Glowberries

    
    
        Monsters

        Greed Blade

    
    
        Abyssal - Thunderspawn

        Pious Chaplain

    
    
        Cultist - Humanoid

        Soul Jar

    
    
        Evil Druid - Humanoid

        Spirit Blast

    
    
        The Swarm

        Spirit Hunter

    
    
        Undead - Stormwraith

        

    
    
        

        Guardians

    
    
        Special

        Unholy Guardian

    
    
        Amulet Treasures

        

    
    
        Ulbrick's Treasures

        

    
    
        Disease - Special

Name: Battleships Zenith!
Description:
NWS: Battleships Zenith (1930-1945) is a Windows based computer combat system merged with a set of naval rules for miniatures or board game hex based tactical naval combat covering from 1930-1945.

Features:

     50 page rules manual including a set of reference charts in PDF.
     Radar reference chart covering 6 month intervals of radar fittings and modifications from 1939-1945.
     Rapid fire and efficient combat system that will allow for large battles to be played quickly and efficiently.
     Can be played as a stand alone set of miniature rules or for hex based board game rules with or without the computer.
     A chart for allowing one die roll to be used to handle multiple die rolls for faster damage results.
     Windows based computer combat system, scenario editor tool, reference information, and other game material on CD.
     Nations include: Japan, Germany, France, Netherlands, Australia, Italy, United Kingdom, United States, and the Soviet Union.
     Detailed game data for 200+ classes of warships and 1400+ ships in the scenario editor base.
     20+ types of land units included covering airfields, coastal batteries, infantry and armored units, etc..
     Includes 3 six sided dice for game play.
     Game scale: 1 turn = 3 minutes, 1 DU (Distance Unit) = 1000 yards (0.5nm)
     Rules and data for float/spotter aircraft and anti-aircraft fire.
     Scenario editor software with a wide variety of scenario building options including ship starting damage, radar fit, crew quality, ammunition, weather conditions, visibility, turn based weather changes and daylight transition, etc.
     Detailed printable unit sheets for all 200+ ship classes and land units on the game CD in PDF format.
     Each unit sheet has detailed data for each unit in the game, space for 20 turns of combat and maneuvers, and sideview drawings.
     Detailed rules covering movement, spotting, speed loss from turning, stack and chemical smoke, radar effectiveness, etc.
     Gunnery effectiveness based on calculations covering a ships ‘accuracy’ of fire and ‘volume’ of fire.
     Ship movement is affected by acceleration, deceleration, turning rates, turning speed loss, sea state, and listing.
     Firepower ratings for each main, secondary, and tertiary gun turrets or mounts.
     Spotting details that include the size of spotter and target, visibility, weather, smoke, and optional rules for levels of identification.
     Radar rules that cover effectiveness, crew quality, land and sea clutter interference, and blind fire.
     Detailed gunnery combat calculations that cover both volume and accuracy of fire and include target range and speed,gun quality, fire controls, target identification, shell types, etc.
     Detailed damage system for above and below waterline damage covering main gun turrets, secondary or tertiary firepower, torpedo mounts, con/bridge, rudder/steering, propulsion, radars, and searchlights, fires, flooding, progressive flooding, listing, damage control, and magazine explosions.
     The Windows based computer combat system (CCS) allows scenarios to be played without the use of any paperwork.
     250 ships and 50 land unit capacity using the CCS.
     The CCS keeps track of the status of each unit, ammunition, damage, and progressive flooding.
     The CCS allows you to enter the combat data for each firing unit and target unit and at the end of each turn the CCS will simultaneously resolve all gunnery and torpedo combat and display 2 optional detail levels of results.
     All combat is recorded using a After Action Report (AAR) using a printable or viewable TXT (text) format.


BZ Website: http://www.navalwarfare.net/drbz.html

Name: Monopoly: Peanuts Collector's Edition
Description:
Publisher Blurb:

You’ve Come A Long Way, Charlie Brown! The world’s most popular comic strip and America's favorite board game team up to bring you Charlie Brown, Snoopy and the entire PEANUTS gallery. Vie to own the PEANUTS neighborhood, including the Brick Wall, Pumpkin Patch, Root Beer Bar & Bus Stop. This completely customized game comes with all-new collectible pewter tokens, including Snoopy as the Flying Ace, Woodstock, Lucy, Linus, Sally and Charlie Brown. A must-have for all PEANUTS fans!

Name: Dreadnought Rising!
Description:
NWS: Dreadnought Rising! (1906-1929) is a Windows based computer combat system merged with a set of naval rules for miniatures or board game hex based tactical naval combat covering from 1906-1929.

Features:

     50 page rules manual including a set of reference charts in PDF on CD-ROM.
     Rapid fire and efficient combat system that will allow for large battles to be played quickly and efficiently.
     Can be played as a stand alone set of miniature rules or for hex based board game rules with or without the computer.
     A chart for allowing one die roll to be used to handle multiple die rolls for faster damage results.
     Windows based computer combat system, scenario editor tool, reference information, and other game material on CD.
     Nations include: Britain, Germany, France, Italy, Russia, and Austria-Hungary.
     Detailed game data for 200+ classes of warships and 1100+ ships in the scenario editor base.
     20 types of land units included covering airfields, coastal batteries, infantry, etc..
     Includes 3 six sided dice for game play.
     Game scale: 1 turn = 3 minutes, 1 DU (Distance Unit) = 1000 yards (0.5nm)
     Rules and data for float/spotter aircraft and anti-aircraft fire.
     Scenario editor software with a wide variety of scenario building options including ship starting damage, crew quality, ammunition, weather conditions, visibility, turn based weather changes and daylight transition, etc.
     Detailed printable unit sheets for all 200+ ship classes and land units on the game CD in PDF format.
     Each unit sheet has detailed data for each unit in the game, space for 20 turns of combat and maneuvers, and sideview drawings.
     Detailed rules covering movement, spotting, speed loss from turning, stack smoke, etc.
     Gunnery effectiveness based on calculations covering a ships ‘accuracy’ of fire and ‘volume’ of fire.
     Ship movement is affected by acceleration, deceleration, turning rates, turning speed loss, sea state, and listing.
     Firepower ratings for each main, secondary, and tertiary gun turrets or mounts.
     Spotting details that include the size of spotter and target, visibility, weather, smoke, and optional rules for levels of identification.
     Detailed gunnery combat calculations that cover both volume and accuracy of fire and include target range and speed, gun quality, target identification, shell types, Director and Fire Control fittings, etc.
     Detailed damage system for above and below waterline damage covering main gun turrets, secondary or tertiary firepower, torpedo mounts, con/bridge, rudder/steering, propulsion, searchlights, fires, flooding, progressive flooding, listing, damage control, and magazine explosions.
     The Windows based computer combat system (CCS) allows scenarios to be played without the use of any paperwork.
     250 ships and 50 land unit capacity using the CCS.
     The CCS keeps track of the status of each unit, ammunition, damage, and progressive flooding.
     The CCS allows you to enter the combat data for each firing unit and target unit and at the end of each turn the CCS will simultaneously resolve all gunnery and torpedo combat and display 2 optional detail levels of results.
     All combat is recorded using a After Action Report (AAR) using a printable and viewable TXT (text) format.
     Uses the same combat mechanics as our "Battleships Zenith!" wargame.


DR Website: http://www.navalwarfare.net/drbz.html

Name: Irondale: Irondale Expands
Description:
Irondale: Irondale Expands, is the first expansion for Irondale.  The expansion itself contains several smaller expansions, add-ons, and variants.

Irondale Expands includes 18 new Building cards (3 copies of each - 1 for each deck), including a new building type: Monuments.  Also included are 3 new Special Buildings including the Architect's Guild and the Banking Institution, which enable trade withing the game and add extra options to the existing Master Plan mechanic.  The City Square is also a new special building which is used to change the way Irondale is played.  4 new dedicated start city cards are also included.

This expansion is completely modular, and players may choose to use any or all included material to enhance their games of Irondale.

A copy of Irondale is required to play Irondale Expands.
Families: Series: Pure Card Line (Small Box Games)

Name: Idol Hands and the Crystal Monkey Skulls
Description:
Idol Hands and the Crystal Monkey Skulls is a simple game with a goofy name.  This game is part of Small Box Games' Pure Card Line.

Game play is a breeze! Players may either take all idols of a single color from the middle of the play area and add them to their hand, or combine Idols from their hand with Tablets to score points.  But beware, the dreaded Crystal Monkey Skulls are bad juju, and once seven have been revealed, the game ends, and players lose points for unused idols in their hands.
Families: Series: Pure Card Line (Small Box Games)

Name: On The Edge
Description:
On The Edge is an abstract block-stacking game for two players:
From the Rules:
Be the first person to stack your cubes on their edge making sure not cover any white square in the center of each cube.

Play of the game:
Each player takes 8 of the same coloured cubes. Each cube has a weight on one side, so that when stacking players will need to put the side with the weight on the cube below it. To start, take any cube from your pile and place it on a flat surface in front of you. Take another cube and stack it on the edge of your first cube. Be sure not to stack the cube on the white square in the centre. Continue stacking until you have stacked all 8 of your cubes. If your cubes should fall, continue stacking.

There are two alternate ways to play: a race to stack your cubes or take turns and stack on a shared stack. First to cause the stack to fall, loses the round. Play for five rounds.

Name: Chieftain Chess
Description:
Chieftain Chess is a structured multi-move game for 2 teams of 1-4 players/side. It is scalable, with larger and smaller versions available. A chess-wargame fusion that uses 5 different types of simple short-range chess-like pieces, it mimics various aspects of an ancient battle on a 12x16 rectangular field. Four chiefs [the strongest but not the fastest pieces] per side lead their 32 piece armies in a set-piece battle that begins just after the 2 armies start to close with each other.

Victory is achieved by killing all 4 enemy chiefs before your 4 get killed. Players move as many pieces per turn as they have friendly chiefs on the board. The moving pieces must be within "command control range" of the chiefs, generally 3 squares, to be able to move that turn. This forces the royal pieces to be active participants in the heat of the battle, rather than trying to hide in the corners like the kings of chess.

Most games, regardless of size, are determined in 30-40 turns. The game is designed so the pace increases from beginning to end. The players start with 1 chief for every 8 pieces, so they move about 12% of their armies each turn in the beginning. By midgame, 20-25% of the army moves each turn, and by the endgame, roughly 50% of the remaining pieces move each turn.

The game trades space for time compared to western chess. Where attacks in chess are sequenced deeply in time but concentrated in space, in Chieftain multiple attacks are spread out across space, but can't be accurately calculated more than 2 or 3 turns deep in time. It has a deliberate, almost defining theme, yet it is a pure abstract game, with perfect information, and in its specific "combat" pieces and their movement rules, there is no semblance of reality. What it allows is a game played on 2 levels, the tactical level being a pure, simple chess variant, and the strategic level being a simulation of a wargame.

The game may be played online at chessvariants.org, or a Chieftain Chess set can be made from 2 complete sets of chesspieces and 3 same-sized chess boards, one cut in half, for face to face play.

Name: Hope County Stories: Alien Abduction the Board Game
Description:
Hope County Stories is a series of board games, each with it’s own unique and exciting theme, which all use the same game board and feature a cast of characters from the community.

Although using the same game board and characters, each different game (or story) will provide it’s own set of rules, game cards, tokens and variations on game play.

As more Stories are introduced, you will follow the inhabitants of Hope County as they face all manner of threats to their very existence; whether it is a horde of Zombies, an evil blood sucking Vampire, an Alien Spaceship trying to abduct innocent townsfolk, or even rampaging Werewolves.

Those players who have played Night of the Bloodsuckers 2nd Edition, or Night of the Slasher, may already be familiar with the people and places of Hope County.

Alien Abduction (for 2 to 5 players)

In the first of this series of games, players will race around Hope County trying to save members of their family from being abducted by the mysterious Alien ship which has appeared over the town!

The files for this 'Print and Play' game can be downloaded from http://www.wargamedownloads.com/cat.php?ItemSubcategory=60&pics

Components Supplied 
The Alien Abduction Game Files (all in PDF Format) include the game board and all the game cards, tokens and playing pieces required to play.

Additional Components Required (not supplied)
1 x 12 sided die
1 x 6 sided die
5 x Plastic Markers (each player’s for Health track)
5 x Plastic Stands (for each playing piece)

Name: 3 Little Words
Description:
From The Rules:

"The basic principle of 3 Little Words is that ANYTHING can be described using only 3 words.  For example, 'mouse hunting pet' is ... CAT!  A player studies an 'answer' on the cards, and tries to describe it in only 3 words.  The other players try to guess the answer.  The first player to get it right wins a point, and so does the asking player.  First player to 20 points wins!"

Contents are: Rules, 1d6 and a set of cards with 'answers' on them.

Name: À la dérive
Description:
From the publisher's website:

The ice fields are melting and penguins are in need of food. Players control 3 penguins that battle it out on the melting ice, trying to secure food tiles while gathering the most eggs.
À la derive is a fast paced game running around 45 minutes. 2 to 4 players age 8 and UP.

The box will come with french and english instructions with a language-less set of cards.

Advance description:
À la derive is a card management game mixed with unit placement. Each player controls 3 penguin figurines that they need to move on a grid of moving ice fields. To do so, players use all kind of cards to push or play tricks on their opponents.

The goal is to control the most tiles showing fishes at the start of their turn. The fish tiles gives player new cards each turn to add to their growing deck. Throughout those cards are precious eggs that are needed to win the game. The most eggs win. You will need to carefully manage your hands between egg cards or movement and tricks cards to play on your opponents.

Name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – Rituals of R'hllor
Description:
Fantasy Flight Games is pleased to announce the next exciting Chapter Pack in the Brotherhood Without Banners cycle for A Game of Thrones: the Card Game!

Rituals of R’hllor is the second monthly release in this new cycle, and the second Chapter Pack to adopt the versatile new collation format.

While the Brotherhood without Banners remain loyal to the name of Robert Baratheon, Melisandre of Asshai has worked her way into the confidence of his brother, Stannis. Under her sway, a new, fanatical sect of zealots has risen to power within the fractured ranks of House Baratheon.

Featuring the manipulative red woman Melisandre, as well as a wealth of synergy for cards with the Asshai trait, Rituals of R’hllor will bring new deck-building depth to your A Game of Thrones experience.
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: A Game of Thrones – The Card Game (LCG)

Name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game – The Wailer Below Asylum Pack
Description:
Erin Moirai, a shy Miskatonic student, has been betrayed by a disarmingly charismatic stranger... and it’s little consolation that he was in turn betrayed as well. Now, trapped in a horrific laboratory where not even her thoughts are safe from intrusion, she’s forced to perform dark experiments. The worst, however, is yet to come.

Fantasy Flight Games is pleased to announce the fourth Asylum Pack in The Yuggoth Contract cycle for Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game!

The Wailer Below continues the story of Erin Moirai and Tyler Scindere, while introducing exciting new cards like Sam Archer: Private Investigator, the Degenerate Serpent Cultist, and the vile Feasting Ghouls.

And in part four of the serial short story by Nate French, Erin Moirai is forced to perform a series of alien dissections, as her jailors intrude upon her thoughts.

She has no way of knowing how long she’s been in captivity. Will she find an opportunity to escape, or be trapped forever?

The Wailer Below is a fixed 60 card Asylum Pack that contains 20 different never-before-seen cards based on the dark mythos of master horror writer H.P. Lovecraft, designed to augment existing decks and add variety to the Call of Cthulhu metagame.

Keep checking back for more information, and look for The Wailer Below at your local retailer this summer!
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: Call of Cthulhu – The Card Game – Asylum Packs Set 3 (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: Call of Cthulhu – The Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)

Name: Quactica: Battles for the Soul of Middle Aesopia
Description:
From the Introduction (Edited):

The intent behind the game is to provide a set of skirmish rules (one-on-one combat between characters) streamlined enough that games can be played to a satisfactory conclusion.  In a suitalbly brief amount of time, with considerably more figures than the usual fantasy role-playing game encounter.  In many ways, this is a military adjunct to a Middle Aesopian role-playing campaign, allowing the players to engage in actions larger than a simple dungeon crawl.  Even though the basic rules are bare-boned and straightforward in order to help achieve these ends, they provide a solid foundation for the addition of house-rules and additional material.

Although its roots go back a long way, the mythos of Middle Aesopia is a living story that contines to grow on the Skirmisher interactive forum and in it's soon to be released Quactica role-playing game.

Publisher Blurb:

Quactica: Battles for the Soul of Middle Aesopia was one of the new products Skirmisher released at Gen Con 2008 in Indianapolis. This innovative set of miniatures rules was created by veteran game designer and miniatures sculptor Steve Lortz, author of the famous Perilous Encounters rules released by Chaosium in 1978. Set in a world inhabited by various races of anthropomorphic animals - including Ducks, Dwargs, and Porks - the Quactica rules tie in with a beautiful line of miniatures created by Lortz and produced by Skirmisher Publishing LLC.

Name: ASL Annual '93a
Description:
One of the Avalon Hill magazines presenting articles and scenarios for Advanced Squad Leader. First of two parts for 1993

From the Table of Contents:
Panzer Gegen Panzer by Bruce Bakken
Annual Crossfire by Robert Banozic & Mark Nixon
Getting The Lead Out by Steve Powlesland
Beating About The Bush by Philippe Leonard
Grace Under Fire by Guy Chaney
The Illustrated & Legible Advanced Sequence Of Play by The Staff
Iron Eagle by Rex A. Martin

Scenarios:
A51 Clash Along The Pesl
A52 Swan Song
A53 Smith & Weston
A54 The Raate Road
A55 The Cat Has Jumped
A56 A Good Party
A57 First Banzai
A58 Munda Mash
A59 Death At Carentan
A60 Totsugeki!
DA11 Sicilian Midnight

Expands:

    Advanced Squad Leader

Name: Oh Quay
Description:
adapted from The Decktet Book

In a river town, east of the Sapphire ports, you manage a canal where rafts of cargo are lashed together before being launched into the current and sent downstream. Your opponent manages a parallel canal. If your luck and skill are enough, you can clear your canal and get to the pub while he is still sorting boxes.

Oh Quay can be played without any table space, with the players holding all of the cards in their hands. So it's a game you can play while standing in line, sitting in the back of a car, or with your feet dangling off a pier.

Name: Coyote!
Description:
Description from publisher:

We are shepherds and farmers keeping sheep. We put as many sheep and lambs to pasture as we safely can... but from time to time the Coyotes come round.

They are tricky, but not always as clever as we are. We have barn space and the help of our trusty Sheep Dog and Amazing Llama to protect our flock. As Night approaches we will have to be especially alert and ready to work as a team.

Object of the Game: Fill in 35 pasture spaces with as many sheep as we safely can before the Night Fall card is exposed to end the game.

Name: Robin Hood's Adventure Game
Description:
An original Archery Board game with the theme of Robin Hood Fun and easy to play a game for all the Family (Description from the front of the box)

Contents 1 Board 1 Target stand and boss 6 Players and stands 6 Sets of Arrows 6 Score Pads 2 Coloured dice 2 Spotted dice ! dice Shaker 1 Set of Rules

The Theme really is Medieval and Archery rather than anything to do with Robin Hood

Players move around the board hoping to land on squares where they are allowed to "shoot" their arrows and avoid other squares that do not help you The "shooting"is done by rolling special dice and marking their "shots" with the plastic arrows on the neat little Archery target and keeping score on a score pad Once you have acheived a score of 21 you race to the finish

The pieces and the board are a delight and look almost handmade however the box is bland and over large
Families: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Robin Hood

Name: What Was That Name?
Description:
(as taken from front cover of rules)

Any number of people can play "What Was That Name?"  It can be used as a part game in teams, just for a small group, or only two people.

The object of the game is for each player or team to list as many famous names as possible from the initials provided by the cards.

Name: South American Rails
Description:
Explore the continent of South America, from the deepest parts of the Amazon Rain Forest, to the alpine peaks of the Andes, and the resource rich southern tip.

This game is based on the popular Crayon Rails system.  Players receive three demand cards which each have three possible deliveries.  To complete a delivery a player must connect the demanding city with the city that supplies the good it needs.  Building track costs money, and the payout for each load is always going to be slightly less than the cost to build the track to make the connection.  This pricing mechanism forces players to coordinate the deliveries on all three cards to maximize the use of their track in order to turn a profit.  Once one of the three deliveries on a card is made, a new card is drawn to take its place.  Play continues until a player reaches $250 million and has connected all but one of the major cities.

This print and play game is free to download.  It requires a copy of another crayon rails game for the money and trains.

Name: Deck of Dice
Description:
From the Publisher:

Deck of Dice is not a single game so much as a game system.  By using a unique set of dice players can adapt any classic card game into a dice game!  The games play much faster and have twists that only dice can bring (like being able to re-roll your hand.)

A set of six dice per player allows for the potential of any combination of 6 values in six suits to be rolled.  The suits in Deck of Dice are Hearts, Spades, Diamonds, Clubs, Coins, and Blanks.

The game includes a sheet of labels to attach to standard six-sided dice allowing for 2-6 players (each with their own distinct colour) along with a die for rolling trump (in those games requiring it) and player screens for keeping player's hands secret.

Included in the base rule booklet are adaptations of seven classic card games: Hearts, Euchre, Knockout Whist, Crazy Eights, Go Fish, My Ship Sails and Red Dog.

Name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – Illyrio's Gift
Description:
Illyrio’s Gift is the first pack in the Brotherhood Without Banners cycle. It introduces a new era of factions and subfactions to your deck.

Illyrio’s Gift is the first monthly installment of 60 fixed cards for the Brotherhood Without Banners expansion to A Game of Thrones: The Card Game. The never-before-seen cards in this expansion were designed to augment existing decks and add variety to the A Game of Thrones metagame. Featuring the hard-to-kill lightning lord Beric Dondarrion, as well as other popular characters like Edric Dayne and Rakharo, Illyrio’s Gift will bring a new level of theme and strategy to A Game of Thrones.
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: A Game of Thrones – The Card Game (LCG)

Name: Reclameraden
Description:
A trivia game about commercials.
Players throw a six sided dice. On each side there is a different color dot. 
The player has to answer a question in the category resembling the color thrown. When the player answers the question correctly, he/she gets a chip.
The player who has five different colored chips wins the game

Name: The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game: The Fellowship of The Ring Journeybook
Description:
Fight out the battles and encounters of The Fellowship of The Ring Supplement and film on your own tabletop, painting the miniatures and building all the terrain you need as you go. this book is a supplement for Games Workshop's The Lord of The Rings Strategy battle Game - you will need a copy of the rules in order to play.
(publisher website)
Families: Series: The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game (Games Workshop)

Name: The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game: The Two Towers Journeybook
Description:
The journey continues! Fight out the battles and encounters of The Two Towers book and film on your own tabletop, painting the miniatures and building all the terrain you need as you go. this book is a supplement for Games Workshop's The Lord of The Rings Strategy Battle Game - you will need a copy of the rules in order to play.
(publisher website)
Families: Series: The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game (Games Workshop)

Name: The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game: The Return of the King Journeybook
Description:
This supplement allows you to fight out the battles and encounters of The Return of the King book and film on your own tabletop, painting the miniatures and building the terrain you need as you go.

This is a supplement for Games Workshop's The Lord of The rings Strategy Battle Game - you will need a copy of the rules in order to play.
(publisher website)
Families: Series: The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game (Games Workshop)

Name: Ingenious Challenges
Description:
Created by renowned game designer Reiner Knizia, Ingenious Challenges contains three games of mental dexterity for 2-4 players. Retaining the spirit of its predecessor board game Ingenious, the games in Ingenious Challenges challenge players to score as many points as possible in each color/symbol while also forcing them to score points in all colors/symbols in order to do well. Four scoreboards with colored pegs and tracks for each color are used in each game, while the dice, cards and single-symbol tiles are used separately in their particular games.

• In the Card Challenge (published separately as Einfach Genial: Das Kartenspiel), a player receives a hand of six cards, with one card placed face-up in front of him. On a turn, he plays one of his hand cards and scores as many points for each symbol on the played card as there are symbols lying in front of all players. These points are marked in the matching color track on a player's individual scoring board, and the first player to have seven or more points in all colors wins. Progress is complicated by three barriers on the scoring tracks, which cannot be passed unless all colors have been bumped to a certain level of points – thereby forcing players to push their colors evenly.

• In the Dice Challenge (Einfach Genial: Das Würfelspiel), players roll dice up to three times, then score as many points for each symbol on the rolled dice as there are symbols on the dice in front of the other players. Players record these points on their scoring boards, with the barriers causing hiccups on the way, and the first player to move all colors to seven points wins.

• In the Tile Challenge (Einfach Genial: Wer zu viel riskiert, verliert!), all 126 tiles (21 of each color/symbol) are shuffled face down, then three are placed face up in a shared pool. On a turn, a player reveals a tile. If the tile doesn't match one in the pool, he adds all tiles revealed this turn to the pool and ends his turn; if it does match, the player can collect all tiles revealed this turn and all matching tiles in the pool, or take another turn. If you're the first player to collect seven tiles of each color, you win. If a player has a single color with fewer tiles in it than all other colors and a tile of that color is in the pool, the player can take one such tile and end his turn; this rule allows players to work toward that final color they need, while also pushing other players to try to remove that color from the pool.

Incorporates:

    Einfach Genial: Das Kartenspiel
    Einfach Genial: Das WÃ¼rfelspiel
    Simply Ingenious

Name: Deft-initions
Description:
Deft-initions™ is the great, new, anytime anywhere word-guessing game.

Based on the fact that many English words have disparate, widely distinct definitions — all of which are correct!

Each of 300 cards has a word to be guessed, and eight different definitions/clues — all of which are accurate.

A reader selects a clue, reads it out loud, and the other players shout out what they think the word to be guessed is. Each of the different clues is read until someone guesses the word, or the reader stumps them.

Created to be played by people with a 12 year old's vocabulary level.

Think you know what words mean?
Try to guess what common word the eight definitions/clues below refer to:

* A small mistake
    * A piece of paper used as a record
    * A part of a plant used for grafting
    * A place for a ship
    * To slide suddenly and lose one's balance
    * You don't want to get a pink one
    * Of the tongue • one's mind • through one's fingers
    * Rhymes with flip

Right! The answer is "slip".

To Play
A reader selects five clues from the eight shown (at least one must be a red clue) and reads them aloud, one at a time. The other players shout out their guesses. The correct guesser earns points depending on which clue he/she solves. Clues separated by dots indicate phrases or sayings that use the mystery word. An optional roll of the die can add a bonus or a penalty to a score depending on a player’s luck.

From Publisher (http://www.lexogon.com/deftinitions.html)

Name: Democracy
Description:
From the Game instructions:

"The game consists of a Democracy Board with a spinning dial in the center and a road around the edge of the board over which the Players travel; six individual Charts for players, each chart with a scoring device on top; one Priorities Board Chart; forty-eight Defense Units in eight groups, each group being characterized by a different color background; six individual players Tokens, each of a different color.

The winner of "Democracy" is the first person to win $8,000,000.  Thus he arrives at a financial position which enables him to purchase all the units of a complete National Defense.  As the game progresses, many unforeseen things may happen to each player.  Just as in real life. Strikes, sabotage, shortages, troubles of all kinds beset the way but the end is well worth while."

Name: Alex Máxima
Description:
Trivia game about the Dutch monarchy.
The start player rolls the dice and gets a question according to color rolled on the dice. The questions are on cards and are assigned to five different colors. If answered correctly, the player gets a chip in the corresponding color and the turn goes to the next player. If answered incorrectly, the turn goes directly to the next player. Whoever gets all five colored chips wins the game.

Name: Cabaret Pret
Description:
A trivia game with the theme of Dutch cabaret.
The start player rolls the dice and gets a question according to color rolled on the dice. The questions are on cards and are assigned to five different colors. If answered correctly, the player gets a chip in the corresponding color and the turn goes to the next player. If answered incorrectly, the turn goes directly to the next player. Whoever gets all five colored chips wins the game.

Name: Warfare
Description:
Published 1985 by "Hahn"

"The object of warfare is to win control of your opponents government. To do this you must capture any two of his "JEL" pieces. JEL represents Judicial, Executive, and Legislative branches of our government. Lose one JEL piece and your country can still function, but lose the second JEL and you lose control of your government and the war."

Warfare is an abstract strategy game similar in play style to stratego or chess with players taking alternating turns, where they may move, attack, or retreat (though there is no secret unit deployment as with Stratego). To win one must capture two of the opponents "JEL" pieces, which also have the ability to move and attack. The playing pieces are of various military and civilian ranks (JEL, Secret Service, General, Admiral,Army, Nacy, Airforce, and Marines). Each has a particular set of rules in how it can be moved, how far, or under what conditions/direction it can attack. Black squares on the game board represent land, while white squares represent water. Certain pieces may only move or attack on either by virtue of their class (Navy can only move/attack on water, while army can only move/attack on land).

Name: Blitzkrieg in France
Description:
Issue game of old Game Journal 54.

Designed by Masayoshi Imura.
Covers the blitzkrieg in France in 1940.
The game uses chit-pull activation system.
1 map
180 counters
16 cards
You must prepare a die.

The article by Jun Tajima covers the 11 1940 blitzkrieg games and categorizes these into 4 groups.  This article is very interesting and must read for gamers interested in this topic.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Boshin-sensou
Description:
This wargame covers the Meiji restoration in Japan during the late 19th century. This is the most detailed game on this topic.

The game uses a random-preparation chart until the battle of Toba-Fushimi. Then, the players start the Boshin war with determined members and units.

Contents:

    1 map
    180 counters
    1 preparation chart
    2 playaid sheets


Published in (old) Game Journal 53.
Families: History: Boshin War & Meiji Era Rebellions
Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Destination Graduation
Description:
From rules booklet: This game is designed for children to talk about school and what is going on in their world; how they feel, what they think and choices they might make, while also reinforcing the importance of education.

Object: To go through the obstacles and finish school - "Destination Graduation."

Contents:
Game board
6 player pawns
1 d6
96 Obstacle cards
24 Oh Rats cards
24 Rat On cards
12 Go cards

Name: Kawanakajima Gunki
Description:
Issue game of Wargame Japanese History #5.

This game covers the very famous fourth Kawanakajima battle in 1561 (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battles_of_Kawanakajima).
A "gunki" is a war story (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gunki_monogatari).

This game uses map areas and each player secretly deploy his forces using planning sheets.

Components:

    8 page rulebook
    80 counters
    1 map
    2 dice

Name: Politie Verhoor
Description:
A trivia game with a police and detective theme.
The start player rolls the dice and gets a question according to color rolled on the dice. The questions are on cards and are assigned to five different colors. If answered correctly, the player gets a chip in the corresponding color and the turn goes to the next player. If answered incorrectly, the turn goes directly to the next player. Whoever gets all five colored chips wins the game.

Name: Op Vakantie
Description:
A trivia game with vacation and cultures themes.
The start player rolls the dice and gets a question according to color rolled on the dice. The questions are on cards and are assigned to five different colors. If answered correctly, the player gets a chip in the corresponding color and the turn goes to the next player. If answered incorrectly, the turn goes directly to the next player. Whoever gets all five colored chips wins the game.

Contents
- 56 cards with questions
- 25 colored chips
- 1 die
- rules

Name: Mens Medisch
Description: The start player rolls the dice and gets a question according to color rolled on the dice. The questions are on cards and are assigned to five different colors. If answered correctly, the player gets a chip in the corresponding color and the turn goes to the next player. If answered incorrectly, the turn goes directly to the next player. Whoever gets all five colored chips wins the game.

Name: Puzzel Uurtje
Description:
A trivia game with a grammar theme.
The start player rolls the dice and gets a question according to color rolled on the dice. The questions are on cards and are assigned to five different colors. If answered correctly, the player gets a chip in the corresponding color and the turn goes to the next player. If answered incorrectly, the turn goes directly to the next player. Whoever gets all five colored chips wins the game.

Name: Roddelen Maar
Description:
A tivia game with national and international celebrities theme.
The start player rolls the dice and gets a question according to color rolled on the dice. The questions are on cards and are assigned to five different colors. If answered correctly, the player gets a chip in the corresponding color and the turn goes to the next player. If answered incorrectly, the turn goes directly to the next player. Whoever gets all five colored chips wins the game.

Name: War of the Ring: Battlehosts
Description:
The War of the Ring has engulfed the lands in darkness. The armies of Men, Elves and Dwarves clash with Sauron's innumerable legions. At the forefront of these armies stride heroes and battlehosts of great renown who have gathered to oppose the Dark Lord, or destroy in his name. It is by the deeds of these warriors that the War of The Ring, and the fate of Middle-earth, shall be decided.

This 80-page Expansion book contains all of the rules, information and inspiration you need to bring the most iconic bands of warriors from The Lord of the Rings mythos to your tabletop. Also included are new Fortunes and Fates, as well as advice for using your battlehosts in other scenarios, linked games and famous encounters

From publisher's web page
Families: Series: The Lord of the Rings Strategy Battle Game (Games Workshop)

Name: Gold Thief: Pirate
Description: A mini expansion for Gold Thief that is included in the game Whack a Catgirl. With the pirate you can "cheat" and score any one goal card when you have exactly five gold. Or you can use it to block a ninja.

Name: Mega Bots
Description:
Mega Bots is a turn based combat game for two or more players set in a world where conventional weapons of war have been replaced with immense robots.

The game allows players to create and control a robot armed with a variety of weapons and special combat systems.

Mega Bots gives players complete control over the creation of their bot. Players can create an existing bot from popular media or one from their own imagination. The possibilities are endless.

The object of the game is simply to turn the opposing bots into scrap metal

Mega Bots is a stand alone game that can also be used as an expansion for any other Toy Battle System™ game.

Name: Nullkommanix
Description:
The game consists of tiles with four edges in four different colors. The tiles are placed between the players so each player faces one color edge (all tiles have to be aligned accordingly). Each edge contains a number which forms a larger number together with all the tiles in one row. There are also commas, which can turn a potentially large number into a very small one. The idea is to place commas in positions which are at the rear of one's own line, but at the front of another player's, so the other player's number is minimal and the own one is large.
A turn consists of simply flipping over one tile and placing it into the grid. When all tiles are placed, four spaces in the 6 x 6 grid remain empty, thus further influencing the results.
The player with the largest sum of all six lines is the winner.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

Name: The Game of Pittsburgh
Description:
A monopoly-like game, in which 2 to 4 pieces are moved around "property" squares on the board in moves decided by roll of dice.  There are "Fate" and "Fortune" cards, there is currency bills, and there are property cards.

At the end, the player with most property cards is declared the entrepeneur and wins the game.

Name: Drunkfish
Description:
Drunkfish is the party game based on a simple premise: act like a fool or drink like a fish! Players will race to catch fish and return to their homes, all while speaking in accents, drawing on their faces, answering trivia, and attempting to outdo their opponents while maintaining their dignity. Hilarity and hijinks are sure to ensue, so be prepared to see a whole new side of your friends!

Drunkfish is a game for 2 to 6 players ages 21 and up. The game takes approximately 30 minutes to play and includes:
6 pawns
1 six-sided die
44 hilarious fish cards
16 sort-of-funny item cards
1 exclusive Drunkfish shot glass
1 easily cleaned vinyl game board.

Name: Time and Space
Description:
This is the workspace for a new game, called "Time and Space," a project organized by Scott Nicholson.

The goal of this project is to create a game publicly with the engagement of other BGG members.  Scott provides guidelines, and anyone can contribute parts to the game.

As the game develops, voting is used to determine what stays in the game and what is removed.

The game will remain as a print-and-play game until the point that a publisher acquires it.

Intellectual Property Note: Any contributions made to the game become the property of Scott Nicholson.  Attribution will be made where appropriate. As long as the game is available in print-and-play, anyone will be able to print out and enjoy the game.  Once an agreement is made with a publisher, the print-and-play version may be removed.

Research Note: This is also part of a research project, and we will be studying the process as it develops.  In any research reports, we will not use the actual user name or handles of any BGG user.

Name: Patriots Trivia Game
Description: Contains plastic football field gameboard, 3 team pegs, box of 400 trivia cards and one six sided die. The object of the game is to score more points than your opponent at the end of four quarters of play by correctly answering trivia questions.

Name: Sniffle Free Land
Description:
From the game box:

"A fun game for children that stresses the basics of good hygiene and nutrition necessary for cold prevention!  A must for parents, educators, nurses and everyone concerned about the health of our children.

Each player strives to be the first to reach the Sniffle-Free Land.  If he lands on a yellow space he must pick up a card, read it aloud and answer truthfully.  The card teach the basics of rest, nutrition and good hygiene."

Each card has directions to advance or go back a certain number of spaces depending on if the player did or didn't perform the action.  The number of spaces moved is relative to how important the behavior is to cold prevention.

Name: Trivial Pursuit: Disney PIXAR Edition – Bite-Size
Description:
This is another in the "Bite-Size" range of Trivial Pursuit games. It is intended as a portable travel game. The game is packaged in a wedge ("piece-of-pie") shaped box.

The game does not feature a game board, and thus, there is no roll-and-move mechanic. Instead, players roll the color-coded die, and answers a question matching the color rolled. If a player correctly answers a question, he may "go for a wedge" by answering another question in the same category. If he does so, he keeps that card. If the player answers a question incorrectly, it is the next player's turn. Play ends when a player has collected six cards/correctly answered 12 questions.

Featuring 600 questions from the popular Disney/Pixar movies, including:

    Finding Nemo
    Ratatouille
    Monsters, Inc.
    Toy Story 1 & 2
    The Incredibles
    Bugs Life
    Cars


Made in China, released in Australia.

Name: Albuquerque-Opoly
Description:
How do you make a board game about the city of Atlanta?
While it’s impossible to include everything, we jammed as much Atlanta as we could into this box. It’s FULL of history, parks, SPORTS, just one more peach AND...LOTS OF fun! LOOKING FOR A Great WAY TO EXPERIENCE A-Town? HERE IT IS!
Grab Some Friends and
Gather 'Round!
Here's a quick idea of how to play!
Buy your favorite Atlanta properties, increase your rent by collecting
City Blocks and trading them in for Keys to the City. Sound easy?
WELL, ADD IN SOME TRAFFIC JAMS, Property Tax
AND PARKING FINES AND IT GETS A LITTLE
MORE DIFFICULT AND A LOT MORE FUN!

SO CHOOSE YOUR TOKEN AND ADVANCE TO GOATLANTA!
YOU MAY SOON BE THE MAYOR OF Atlanta...
OR YOU MAY BE STUCK IN THE
TRAFFIC JAM OF YOUR LIFE!
Get YOUR Game On!
THIS IS ATLANTA... AND IT’S YOUR ROLL!!

Source - Publisher's Website

Name: Monster-opoly
Description:
What’s a Monster to do?

Let’s face it! Monsters are horribly misunderstood... They’re just trying to get along, just like everybody else. Trying to find a place in the world, make friends, find jobs, fun things to do. Monsters have hopes and dreams, you know.

SO WHY ALL THE SCREAMING?

Everytime we see a monster- WWWHHHHAAAAAAAHHHH! Get over it! Sit down and play a game of MONSTER-OPOLY and get to know these lovable mugs! Collect monster friends, increase your rents with a Scream. This is a game that could change the world! Monsters and humans UNITE!

Why can’t we all just get along?

Source: Publisher's Web Page

Name: Monopoly: Miami Dolphins Collector's Edition
Description:
From the publisher: Fin Fever! What true Dolphin fan hasn't dreamed of owning and running the illustrious Miami Dolphins? Now's your chance as you vie to buy, sell, and trade Dolphin legends from Bob Griese and Paul Warfield to Dan Marino and Zach Thomas. Helmet and Football Cards replace Chance and Community Chest Cards, and might read Win Back to Back Super Bowls, Collect $20 or Dolphins Complete Undefeated Season, Advance to Go! The 6 Collectible Pewter Tokens are: a Quarterback, Linebacker, Cheerleader, Football, Referee's Whistle, and Dolphins Helmet. So strap on your shoulder pads and see if you can match Miami's 1972 perfect season! Game comes with Game Board, Title Deed Cards, Dolphins Money and Banker's Tray, Dolphins Helmet and Football Cards, 32 Luxury Boxes (Houses), 12 Stadiums (Hotels), 2 Dice, 6 Tokens and Game Instructions. For 2 - 6 Players, Ages 8 and Up.

--

The Miami Dolphins Monopoly game is the first customized Monopoly game featuring the best of the Miami Dolphins that allows fans to buy, sell, and trade the most valuable players and championship titles in the quest to own them all.

Name: Spurt að leikslokum: Fyrir 7-12 ára
Description: Expansion for the base game, with 540 new questions for children 7-12 years old.

Name: Two Bit Hack
Description:
Upgrade your computer; hack your friends computer; get the most Valued Productivity out of your machine!

2 to 4 players compete to get the most bang for their buck for their machines while slowing down other players.  This card game features 120 cards and lets players manipulate the deck and their luck to activate their card functions.  But other players get to activate their functions in the same register #, even on your turn, and cause havoc with your plans. And the deck stacking isn't the only way to activate your card functions.

As with all computers, random factors can cause you benefits or issues.  So, dice also activate function #s.  And as you replace your hardware, you get to fun your functions one more time as well.  There are combinations of actions that can lead to very interesting results and evolved complexity/depth.  Overall the game can be very deep, but is still accessible and easy to learn.

The game plays via rounds and is only very loosely "turn-based".  Players can buy and use actions/cards even when it's not their turn.  There are game balancing mechanics to help losing players catch up.

This game falls into the Race for the Galaxy, San Juan, Glory to Rome, category of games in that you build your own arrangement of cards in front of you, and try to build combos.  Cards are bought via hand discards, but Two Bit Hack has a very unique method for how card functions are activated.  This aspect is most similar to Settlers of Catan.  Also, cards in hand are not only your money, but also your method of activating your functions with certainty.  Or you can leave things more up to luck and leave more cards in your hand for purchasing.

Name: Spurt að leikslokum: HM í fótbolta
Description: Expansion for the base game, with 540 new questions about the FIFA World Cup competitions.

Name: Spurt að leikslokum: Popp – dægurmál – afþreying
Description: Expansion for the base game, with 540 new questions on music, pop culture and recreation.

Name: Spurt að leikslokum: Úr ýmsum áttum
Description: Expansion for the base game, with 540 new questions on various subjects.

Name: Citaten Spel
Description:
Trivia game with 'quotes' theme.
The start player rolls the dice and gets a question according to color rolled on the dice. The questions are on cards and are assigned to five different colors. If answered correctly, the player gets a chip in the corresponding color and the turn goes to the next player. If answered incorrectly, the turn goes directly to the next player. Whoever gets all five colored chips wins the game.

Name: Liefde Leven
Description:
A romantic trivia game.
The start player rolls the dice and gets a question according to color rolled on the dice. The questions are on cards and are assigned to five different colors. If answered correctly, the player gets a chip in the corresponding color and the turn goes to the next player. If answered incorrectly, the turn goes directly to the next player. Whoever gets all five colored chips wins the game.

Whoever gets all five colored chips wins the game.

Trivia game about things that make worth living for.
The start player rolls the dice and gets a question according to color rolled on the dice. The questions are on cards and are assigned to five different colors. Name: Oranje Boven
Description:
Trivia game about the Netherlands.
The start player rolls the dice and gets a question according to color rolled on the dice. The questions are on cards and are assigned to five different colors. If answered correctly, the player gets a tile in the corresponding color and the turn goes to the next player. If answered incorrectly, the turn goes directly to the next player. Whoever gets all five colored tiles wins the game.

Contents
- 112 question cards
- 20 tiles
- 1 Dutch flag tile
- 1 die
- rules
